tool_description: Calculates key dividend and dividend growth parameters for a selected security.
name: Financial tools related to dividend and dividend growth
title: Financial tools related to dividend and dividend growth
tool_name: Financial tools related to dividend and dividend growth

api_list.name: calcYield
api_list.description: This tool calculates the average dividend yield over a given period. The period is in years, but can be any positive real number. For example period=1.5 represents one and a half year. symb is the ticker symbol of the security. The output represents the yield. To obtain the yield in percent, multiply by 100.

required_parameters.name: symb
required_parameters.description: symb is the ticker symbol of the security.

optional_parameters.name: period
optional_parameters.description: The period is in years, but can be any positive real number. For example period=1.5 represents one and a half year.

api_list.name: calcTotReturn
api_list.description: Total return is the amount of value an investor earns from a security over a specific period, when all distributions are reinvested.  The period is in years, but can be any positive real number. For example period=1.5 represents one and a half year. symb is the ticker symbol of the security. The output represents the total return. To obtain the total return in percent, multiply by 100.

required_parameters.name: period
required_parameters.description: The period is in years, but can be any positive real number. For example period=1.5 represents one and a half year.

required_parameters.name: symb
required_parameters.description: symb is the ticker symbol of the security.

api_list.name: calcCagr
api_list.description: This growth rate is the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) in cash dividends per share of common stock over a given number of years (period). Dividend growth is a good indicator of the financial health of a company. mySymb is the ticker symbol of the security.

required_parameters.name: period
required_parameters.description: Number of years backwards for calculating the CAGR. Must be a positive integer.

required_parameters.name: mySymb
required_parameters.description: mySymb is the ticker symbol of the security.

api_list.name: calcPayoutRatio
api_list.description:
The dividend payout ratio is the ratio of the total amount of dividends paid out to shareholders relative to the net income of the company. It is the percentage of earnings paid to shareholders in dividends.
Here, the trailing 12 months dividend paid is divided by the trailing 12 months GAAP net income.
The input is the ticker symbol of the security. The output is the payout ratio. A value greater than 1 means that the dividend paid in the last 12 months exceeded the company net income.
